newsitem.title: HAITI: At least six dead in Haiti violence.
newsitem.headline: At least six dead in Haiti violence.

text.p: Escalating violence between drug traffickers, police and armed groups in the northern city of Cap-Haitien has killed at least six people since the weekend, U.N. police sources said on Tuesday.
Local residents said vigilante groups armed with knives and machetes were patrolling streets questioning passers-by.
Cap-Haitien is known to be one of several Haitian ports used to transship drugs from Central and South America and the Dominican Republic to the Bahamas and the United States.

"There was a demonstration after this guy escaped from prison, with some 200 people throwing rocks and molotov cocktails at us," an American police trainer working for the United Nations said. "There was even a little attack on us."

Three alleged drug traffickers were killed and one wounded in a shootout with police near the port on Saturday night. The wounded man was taken to a hospital, where he was interrogated by police, but he was shot and killed on Monday morning.
"Someone just came right into the hospital and shot him," the police source said. He did not know if the man was killed by members of his own trafficking ring or by local vigilantes.
The civilian police officer reported at least two other bodies had been found since Sunday, one hacked by machetes and the other shot dead. Police did not release the identities.
